text: Arthur Blythe (July 5, 1940 â€“ March 27, 2017) was an American jazz alto saxophonist and composer. His voice had a vibrato and was within the post-bop sub-genre of jazz. He was born in Los Angeles, California. He performed under the label of Columbia, Enja, and Savant Records. Blythe died of Parkinson's disease at his home in Los Angeles on March 27, 2017, aged 76. ==References== ==Other websites== * * All About Jazz: A Fireside Chat With Arthur Blythe Category:1940 births Category:2017 deaths Category:Deaths from Parkinson's disease Category:Disease-related deaths in Los Angeles Category:American jazz musicians Category:American saxophonists Category:American composers Category:Musicians from Los Angeles
title: Arthur Blythe
